instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power and sound
threads.message:
Arrived heavily liquid damaged from being left out in the rain. Board itself did not suffer too muvh liquid damage. Had to replace IO board and battery.

After replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> and <DIODE>D3320</DIODE> board was powering into the OS but there was no sound.

While measuring around for the no sound issue the board suddenly got stuck at 5v. Now, If board is plugged in with battery theres a steady 20V at 0 amp current draw. If board is plugged in by itself its stuck at 5v 0.7 amp

Already tried DFU restore but no response.

PP3V3 is good 3.3 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.30V

What should be checked next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power and sound
threads.message:
Very likely T2 damaged by liquid spill on audio board.
Poor design from Apple, signal lines of T2 close to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on the connector.

I found one board where <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> was shorted to ground, 004 in diode mode (inside T2).
No speakers sound, but good headphones sound.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power and sound
threads.message: Any troubleshooting we can do to at least get the board to power on again without the sound??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power and sound
threads.message:
Just checked my board and wow my <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is shorted to ground 0.01 in diode mode.

Does this sound like T2 is damaged and cant be fixed at this point to at least get it to turn on again without the sound??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power and sound
threads.message:
Probably T2 got more damage.
You can try DFU mode disconnecting audio board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power and sound
threads.message:
Does it make a difference if battery is plugged in?

with battery get 20v at 0 amp draw

without battery 5v at 0.07 amp

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power and sound
threads.message: If T2 doesn't work properly, <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips cannot switch to 20V.
